snippet: An official arbiter declared a mast part of the building, making the skyscraper higher than the Willis Tower, formerly the Sears Tower, in Chicago.
abstract: One World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan is officially ruled to be taller than Chicago's Willis Tower by Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat, primary arbiter of structural stature; council says spire atop New York building accounts for ruling, even though it has six fewer floors and its roof is more than 100 feet lower than top side of the Willis Tower, formerly the Sears Tower.

byline.original: By PATRICK McGEEHAN and CHARLES V. BAGLI

lead_paragraph: An official arbiter declared a mast part of the building, making the skyscraper higher than the Willis Tower, formerly the Sears Tower, in Chicago.

headline.seo: 1 World Trade Center Is Ruled Tallest Building in the U.S.
headline.main: By a Spire, Manhattan Regains a Title From Chicago
headline.print_headline: By a Spire, Manhattan Regains a Title From Chicago

keywords.value: Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat
keywords.name: organizations
